criteria: Ability to Identify Relevant Health Care Products
Application of Information to Product Selection
descriptions: No understanding of a decision-making process is evident.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of a decision-making process; struggles to apply it.
Shows basic understanding of a decision-making process but application is inconsistent.
Demonstrates a clear understanding of a decision-making process and generally applies it when selecting healthcare products.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of a decision-making process and consistently applies it effectively.
Demonstrates an exceptional understanding of the decision-making process, applying it skillfully and adapting it to various scenarios.
Unable to identify any relevant health care products related to the decision-making process.
Struggles to identify relevant health care products; choices are often inappropriate.
Identifies some relevant health care products but may include irrelevant or inappropriate options.
Consistently identifies relevant health care products suitable for the decision-making process.
Identifies a wide range of relevant health care products, demonstrating a solid understanding of their applications.
Identifies and evaluates a comprehensive range of health care products, demonstrating expertise in selecting the most suitable options.
Unable to apply any information or criteria when selecting health care products.
Applies information inconsistently or inappropriately when selecting health care products.
Applies basic information when selecting health care products but misses key considerations.
Applies relevant information and criteria when selecting health care products, demonstrating sound judgment.
Thoroughly applies relevant information and criteria when selecting health care products, justifying choices effectively.
Demonstrates a sophisticated ability to integrate and apply complex information when selecting health care products, optimizing the decision-making process.
Fails to consider consequences when selecting health care products.
Demonstrates minimal awareness of consequences; unable to articulate potential outcomes.
Considers some consequences but may overlook important factors.
Considers potential consequences when selecting health care products, demonstrating responsible decision-making.
Thoroughly evaluates potential consequences, including both positive and negative outcomes.
Demonstrates exceptional foresight by anticipating and evaluating a wide range of consequences, making well-informed choices.
